course_title: Preparedness and Planning in Humanitarian Emergencies
class_notes: Students in CHE Certificate through March 21, all other MPH and MSPH students may enroll on March 22. This course meets the last 7 weeks of the semester only.
course_description: This course covers the essential principles of emergency preparedness and planning in the international context. Students will become familiar with concepts of the Sphere standards, cluster system, Incident Command System (ICS), emergency operation plan development, and tabletop exercises. The common pitfalls and challenges of emergency preparedness and planning will be discussed. Students will have the opportunity to review an existing plan and tabletop exercise and provide input for their improvement.Two-day intensive course.
